page.title: 17CHURCH & VILLAGE
page.content: The local pub is called The Eight Bells after the peal of bells in the church, one of the finest in Sussex. The Queen's Head is so-called because Queen Anne gave a "bounty" to the church. Her coat of arms still hangs there. The Glebe field used to be part of the vicar's living and goes back at least to 1736 and probably longer. We surveyed and dated the Glebe hedge to find that i is 400-500 years old. It is now rented to the school and the cricket club. About 15-20 peaople attend ordinary services but the church is full for Christmas, Easter, Harvest Festival and Mothers' Day services. There is no Sunday School. Children attend with their parents. The vicar is usually chairman of the Governors of the local school.
